overview: This task consists of visually locating a white pan lying on a blue surface, approaching and aligning the gripper, and executing a controlled top grasp to pick up the pan. The robot relies on object detection, centering over the pan, lowering until contact, and closing the gripper with gentle force, before verifying a stable grasp. The scene shows a single pan dominant in all frames, with clear unobstructed access for the arm. The process is sequential, minimizing disturbances and ensuring a reliable pick-up. The episode appears free from obstacles or occlusions.
preconditions: Pan is fully visible and isolated on the workspace surface
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the pan in the workspace
If not visible, scan using raster pattern
Move TCP above the pan with an offset
Compute grasp pose using top-grasp strategy
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Lower until gentle contact with pan
Verify grasp is stable and pan is held
success_criteria: Pan is firmly grasped and elevated by the robot
No accidental sliding or dropping upon lift
failure_and_recovery: If pan not detected: retry scan
If grasp not stable: repeat grasping sequence
If contact not made: realign and lower again
termination: Task terminates when pan is securely grasped, as confirmed by stability and object-in-gripper conditions.
